item.title: 纽森就援助、移民和辱骂问题与特朗普摊牌
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）在周一迎接唐纳德-特朗普的就职典礼时，对新总统做出了和解的姿态，并指出需要建立伙伴关系和相互尊重。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom greeted Donald Trump’s inauguration Monday with a gesture of conciliation toward the new president, noting the need for partnership and mutual respect.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结联邦土地和水域的可再生能源项目
item.description: 特朗普政府正在冻结对联邦土地和水域上的风能和太阳能项目的授权，这凸显了华盛顿在政策上偏向化石燃料而非可再生能源的鲜明立场。【原文：The Trump administration is freezing authorizations for wind and solar projects on federal lands and water, underscoring the sharp Washington policy pivot to favor fossil fuels over renewables.】

item.title: 特朗普吹捧的千亿美元人工智能 "星际之门 "投资项目将利用太阳能发电
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统宣称将加速美国人工智能发展的千亿美元风险投资，预计将部分依赖于其关注气候问题的前任所青睐的动力来源— 太阳能和电池。【原文：A $100 billion venture that President Donald Trump heralds as accelerating artificial intelligence in the US is expected to depend in part on power sources favored by his climate-focused predecessor — solar and batteries.】

item.title: 巴西官员称特朗普退出《巴黎协定》将给 COP30 带来 "困难
item.description:
COP30主席安德烈-科雷亚-多拉戈（Andre Correa do Lago）表示，美国在气候变化问题上的反转将对全球峰会的讨论产生 "重大影响"。【原文：

The US reversal on climate change will have “a big influence” on discussions at the global summit, said COP30 President Andre Correa do Lago. 

】

item.title: 火灾遏制是如何起作用的，为什么在加利福尼亚如此困难？
item.description: 在洛杉矶人口稠密的社区爆发大火两个多星期后，消防员仍在奋力扑灭伊顿大火和帕利塞兹大火。这些大火造成至少 28 人死亡，16,000 多所房屋和建筑物被烧毁，而造成大火的原因是异常的冬季干旱和干燥的圣安娜风，这些风无情地吹过加利福尼亚的山脉，吹向太平洋。【原文：More than two weeks after flames erupted in densely populated neighborhoods in Los Angeles, firefighters were still struggling to put out the Eaton and Palisades fires. Those blazes — which left at least 28 people dead and destroyed more than 16,000 homes and buildings — were fueled by an unusual winter drought and dry Santa Ana winds relentlessly barreling over California’s mountain ranges and toward the Pacific Ocean.】

item.title: 特朗普退出巴黎协定后，彭博社将资助联合国气候机构
item.description:
迈克尔-布隆伯格（Michael Bloomberg）的慈善组织和其他组织正在介入，以维持美国对负责执行《巴黎协定》的机构的捐款。【原文：

Michael Bloomberg’s philanthropic organization and others are stepping in to maintain US contributions to the agency tasked with implementing the Paris Agreement.

】

item.title: 产能增长推动阿达尼绿色公司利润激增
item.description: 阿达尼绿色能源有限公司（Adani Green Energy Ltd. ）公布的第三季度利润增长了 92%，这主要得益于税收减免和发电量的增加。【原文：Adani Green Energy Ltd. reported a 92% increase in third-quarter profit, helped by a tax write-back and an increase in generation capacity that drove power output.】

item.title: 随着寒流减弱，纽约市气温将回升 20 华氏度
item.description: 本周末，从纽约到美国南部的严寒天气将开始缓和，此前的严寒天气使电网紧张、交通受阻，并给墨西哥湾沿岸带来了降雪。【原文：Bitterly cold weather from New York to the US South will start to moderate by this weekend after straining power grids, snarling transportation and bringing snow to the shores of the Gulf of Mexico.】

item.title: 加州消防员在降雨来临前将面临更强的风力
item.description: 在本周末降雨到来之前，在南加州与野火搏斗的救援人员面临着更强的风力，降雨可能会减缓致命的大火。【原文：Crews battling wildfires in Southern California face more powerful winds before rain is forecast to arrive this weekend and potentially slow the deadly blazes.】

item.title: 绿色投资者从特朗普当选总统中找到一线希望
item.description:
自2021年以来，清洁能源公司的股价每年都在下跌，但有人说该行业已经触底。【原文：

Shares in clean energy companies have fallen every year since 2021, but some say the sector has hit bottom.

】

item.title: 特朗普的农业人选将因生物燃料问题在参议院炙手可热
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统提名监督美国农业的人选曾经是一个团体的负责人，该团体是美国最受欢迎的农产品--生物燃料--的最强烈反对者之一。【原文：President Donald Trump’s nominee to oversee American farming was once head of a group that was among the loudest opponents of a favorite US agriculture product: biofuels.】

item.title: 消防外交的新时代
item.description: 洛杉矶野火是通过共用飞机和多国人员扑灭的。现在，随着火季的重叠和更大的火势，今天的通讯将探讨这些合作是如何经受考验的。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享完整报道。如需了解更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Los Angeles wildfires are being battled by shared planes and multi-national personnel. Now, with overlapping fire seasons and bigger infernos, today’s newsletter looks at how those collaborations are being put to the test. You can read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 要理解特朗普的气候行动，请看里根时代
item.description:
"当时有一种感觉--我现在也看到了--那就是在某种程度上，赢得选举之后，一切就都清楚了，"曾在里根时期担任环境律师的乔纳森-拉什在本周的Zero

节目中说道。【原文：

“There was this sense then – which I see now as well – that somehow having won the election, the decks are cleared,” Jonathan Lash, who was an environmental lawyer in the Reagan years, says on this week’s Zero.

】

item.title: 德国和法国前月电力因寒冷天气预报而飙升
item.description: 德国和法国 2 月份的电力价格飙升，因为一些天气模型预测这一时期的天气将更加寒冷。【原文：German and French power prices for February spiked with some weather models forecasting colder weather for that period.】

item.title: 艾奥云风暴将给英国和爱尔兰带来 "天气炸弹
item.description: 英国气象局预报员说，"艾奥文风暴 "将给爱尔兰和英国带来一颗 "天气炸弹"，引发破坏性的狂风和暴雨。【原文：Storm Éowyn will bring a “weather bomb” to Ireland and the UK, unleashing destructive winds and heavy rain, the Met Office forecaster said.】

item.title: 强劲的美国收益率可能会削弱新兴市场气候融资所急需的资金
item.description: 美国债券收益率持续走高，将迫使私人投资者放弃急需资金应对全球变暖的新兴市场。【原文：Persistently high US bond yields will force private investors to turn their backs on emerging markets desperately in need of financing to fight global warming.】

item.title: 澳大利亚向绿色银行注入 20 亿澳元以刺激停滞不前的绿色支出
item.description: 澳大利亚将向政府所有的清洁能源金融公司注资 20 亿澳元（13 亿美元），以促进对该国能源转型的投资。【原文：Australia is injecting A$2 billion ($1.3 billion) into the government-owned Clean Energy Finance Corp. in a bid to boost investment in the nation’s energy transition.】

item.title: 机场扩建破坏了工党的气候目标
item.description:
航空旅行的无限制增长将消耗更多燃料，并影响环境目标的实现。【原文：

Unfettered growth in air travel will burn more fuel and environmental goals.

】

item.title: 风暴 "艾云 "将袭击英国，英国将面临强风、雨雪天气
item.description: 随着风暴 "艾云 "即将袭击英国，英国将迎来强风、雨雪天气，届时阵风可达 90 英里/小时。【原文：The country is braced for strong winds, rain and snow as Storm Eowyn is set to batter the UK with gusts of up to 90mph on the way.】

item.title: 2024 年欧盟太阳能发电量首次超过煤炭发电量
item.description: 一份报告显示，太阳能发电量的激增帮助这一绿色能源去年在欧盟首次超过了燃煤发电站。【原文：A surge of solar power output helped the green energy source overtake coal-fired stations in the European Union for the first time last year, a report shows.】

item.title: 不间断的野火让全球灭火武器库捉襟见肘
item.description:
洛杉矶的野火是通过共享飞机和多国人员来扑灭的。现在，随着火季的重叠和火势的扩大，这些合作正在经受考验。【原文：

Los Angeles wildfires are being battled by shared planes and multi-national personnel. Now, with overlapping fire seasons and bigger infernos, those collaborations are being put to the test.

】

item.title: 洛杉矶北部发生火灾，威胁重要的州际公路
item.description: 一场植被火灾正在洛杉矶北部迅速蔓延，威胁着加利福尼亚州的一条主要交通要道。【原文：A vegetation fire is spreading rapidly north of Los Angeles, threatening one of California’s main transportation arteries.】

item.title: 130 年来最严重的暴风雪使美国南部陷入极寒混乱之中
item.description: 在美国南部，极端天气通常意味着用木板封住窗户以抵御飓风，在街道上铺设沙袋以阻挡洪水。本周，从佛罗里达州到德克萨斯州，严寒的气温和破纪录的降雪反而让居民们急忙赶往取暖中心，并造成道路和跑道的混乱。【原文：Across the US South, extreme weather usually means boarding up windows against hurricane winds and lining streets with sandbags to hold back floods. This week, freezing temperatures and record-breaking snowfall are instead sending residents from Florida to Texas rushing to warming centers, and causing chaos on roads and runways.】

item.title: 达沃斯气候小组敦促首席执行官帮助适应极端天气
item.description: 世界气象组织秘书长敦促企业更加努力地提供极端天气预警，并帮助将气候变化联系起来。【原文：The Secretary-General of the World Meteorological Organization urged businesses to work harder to provide early warnings on extreme weather and help connect the dots with climate change.】

item.title: 深冻使美国最大电网的电力需求创下冬季纪录
item.description: 随着美国南部从 130 年来最严重的暴风雪中恢复过来，一场深度冰冻正在使整个美国东部的电力供应紧张，使美国最大电网的需求量达到冬季历史最高水平。【原文：A deep freeze is straining power supplies across the eastern US, sending demand on the country’s largest electric grid to an all-time winter high as the South digs out from one of the worst snow storms in 130 years.】

item.title: 卡塔尔希望欧盟重新研究影响液化天然气贸易的 ESG 规则
item.description: 卡塔尔财政部长表示，欧洲为与集团有贸易往来的大公司制定了严格的环境、社会和公司治理报告标准，这一规定造成了不公平竞争。【原文：A European regulation setting strict ESG-reporting standards for large companies trading with the bloc creates unfair competition, Qatar’s finance minister said.】

item.title: 美国养鸡第一大州佐治亚州禽流感威胁出口
item.description: 美国第一大鸡肉生产州佐治亚州确认了最近第二例商业禽群禽流感病例，这使得肉类出口面临风险。【原文：Georgia, the top US chicken-producing state, confirmed its second recent case of bird flu in a commercial poultry flock, putting exports of the meat at risk.】

item.title: 特朗普的气候政策倒退危及为贫困国家提供的重要资金
item.description:
美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）退出了帮助发展中国家应对气候变化的协议，为在极端天气日益恶化的情况下撤回急需的支持奠定了基础。【原文：

US President Donald Trump pulled out of a deal to help developing nations fight climate change, laying the groundwork to withdraw much-needed support as extreme weather gets worse.

】

item.title: 风险建模人员为预测野火寻找答案
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将从保险公司和房主的角度探讨野火问题。首先，风险专家解释了建立类似本月洛杉矶野火模型的艰巨任务。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at wildfires from the perspectives of insurers and homeowners. First, risk experts explain the challenging task of modeling wildfires like the ones seen in Los Angeles this month.】

item.title: 野火风险模型难以预测洛杉矶式火灾
item.description:
保险业专家表示，由于气温升高、植被覆盖、风速和地形等因素的影响，火灾很难预测。【原文：

Fires are notoriously hard to forecast, insurance industry experts say, because of factors ranging from rising temperature levels and vegetation coverage to wind speeds and topographies.

】
